meanings.definition: Wrecks (noun): the remains of something that has been severely damaged or destroyed
meanings.sent1: The wrecks of the old ship lay scattered on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the wrecks of houses were all that remained in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the sandcastle was a city of wrecks, destroyed by a giant monster.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a pile of wrecks after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed the wrecks of ancient pottery, showcasing their beauty even in brokenness.

meanings.definition: Wrecks (verb): causes severe damage to something or someone
meanings.sent1: The reckless driver wrecks his car by crashing into a tree.
meanings.sent2: The hurricane wrecks havoc on the small town, destroying homes and buildings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy wrecks the living room, scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His careless words wrecks her confidence, leaving her feeling insecure.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds wrecks the fragile umbrella, turning it inside out.
